name: Palindromic Rheumatism
chief_complaint: Recurring episodes of joint pain and swelling that come and go unpredictably
symptoms: Swelling in joints (often knees, fingers, wrists)
Redness and warmth over affected joints
physical_findings: No residual joint damage between attacks
prognosis: Variable - may progress to rheumatoid arthritis in some cases, while others remain episodic without permanent joint damage
description: A rare inflammatory arthritis characterized by sudden, recurrent attacks of joint inflammation that resolve completely between episodes. The unpredictable nature and absence of permanent damage distinguish it from rheumatoid arthritis, though some cases may evolve into RA.
